question: Does neuroserpin induce axonal elongation during neuronal development?

methodologicalConsiderations.description: Sterlizing the neuroserpin matches the pre-sterilized medium, but could the sterilization protocol itself affect axon growth?
Is the neuroserpin protein suspended in water, or a buffer of some kind? Could this make a difference?
Could any sort of contaminant or processing artifact from the protein purification process be responsible for axon growth?
When the cells are treated with neuroserpin, are they exposed to circulating air or shaking of the plates? Could this make a difference?

Neuroserpin has a specific functional role, but it is also a protein. Could the neurons detect or metabolize this added protein in a way that alters growth but is unrelated to the identity of the specific protein?
Neuroserpin has a specific functional role as a serine protease inhibitor. This is the one thing we really want to test, our true independent variable.
